section.title: Terminology and notation
section.p: Each of the definitions below are for a linear operator \funcdef{T}{V}{V} on a finite-dimensional vector space V.

li.title: determinant
li.p: the determinant of the matrix \matrixOf{T}{B} for any choice of domain space basis \basisfont{B}

li.title: trace
li.p: the trace of the matrix \matrixOf{T}{B} for any choice of domain space basis \basisfont{B}

li.title: eigenvector
li.p: a nonzero vector \uvec{x} in the domain space such that the image vector T(\uvec{x}) is a scalar multiple of \uvec{x}

li.title: eigenvalue
li.p: a scalar for which there exists an eigenvector \uvec{x} of operator T with T(\uvec{x}) = \lambda \uvec{x}

li.title: eigenspace
li.p: the subspace of the domain space consisting of all eigenvectors of T that correspond to a specific eigenvalue \lambda, along with the zero vector
notation for the eigenspace of operator T corresponding to the eigenvalue \lambda

li.title: characteristic polynomial
li.p: the degree-n polynomial in the variable \lambda obtained by computing \det(\lambda I - T)
notation for the characteristic polynomial of operator T
